sentence.Network_en: Naturally, this did not slake Schleicher's thirst of power.
sentence.Network_cn: 自然这并没有满足施莱歇对权力的渴望.

sentence.Network_en: Fair words slake wrath; fair words hurt not the mouth.
sentence.Network_cn: 好言好语息人怒; 说好话于己无损.

sentence.Network_en: We had to slake ourselves with rainwater in the desert.
sentence.Network_cn: 在沙漠中我们不得不用雨水解渴.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English slacian 'become less eager', also 'slacken', from the adjective slæc 'slack'; compare with Dutch slaken 'diminish, relax'

entry.def: If you slake your thirst, you drink something that stops you being thirsty.

example.ex: I slaked my thirst with three cans of Coke.
example.tran: 我喝了 3 罐可乐解渴。

means.word_mean: 3. cause to heat and crumble by treatment with water;

auth_sentence.content: I...feel daily that thy love beginneth to slake.
auth_sentence.res_content: I...feel daily that thy love beginneth to slake.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I...feel daily that thy love beginneth to slake.

auth_sentence.content: Even if Georgia ever got the boundary moved, it still wouldn't necessarily be able to slake its thirst.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even if Georgia ever got the boundary moved, it still wouldn't necessarily be able to slake its thirst.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even if Georgia ever got the boundary moved, it still wouldn't necessarily be able to slake its thirst.

auth_sentence.content: But do take a bottle of water down, not to douse sparks, but to slake a dusty thirst.
auth_sentence.res_content: But do take a bottle of water down, not to douse sparks, but to slake a dusty thirst.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But do take a bottle of water down, not to douse sparks, but to slake a dusty thirst.
